N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 566.1 - Eligible employees

State Regulations

The following State officers and employees in the Executive

Branch are eligible to exchange excess vacation credits for cash
payment: (a) officers and employees
whose positions have been designated managerial or confidential pursuant to
article 14 of the Civil Service Law, including those covered by section
19
of the

Correctional Law, and those in the professional service in the State University
who are designated, stipulated or excluded from negotiating units as managerial
or confidential; (b) employees
covered by paragraph (a) of subdivision 1 of section
215
of the

Executive Law; (c) employees
excluded from representation rights under article 14 of the Civil Service Law
pursuant to rules and regulations of the Public Employment Relations Board; and
(d) employees in the Division
of Military and Naval Affairs who are eligible to participate in the group term
insurance plan authorized under section
158
of the

Civil Service Law. Employees in these eligible categories who are paid on a
part-time basis may participate and receive the exchange payment on a prorated
basis. Employees in these covered categories who are on leave are eligible to
participate in the program. Employees whose salaries are prescribed by section
169
of the

Executive Law or whose salaries were prescribed by that section prior to the
enactment of Chapter 55 of the Laws of 1979, and those in negotiating units
represented by employee organizations pursuant to article 14 of the Civil

Service Law, are not eligible to participate in the exchange
program. Notes
